paper_abstract: We define two functions f(DL) and f(IF) in NPMV, the class of all partial, multivalued functions computed nondeterministically in polynomial time. We prove that they are complete for NPMV, and show that (a) computing discrete logarithms modulo a prime reduces to f(DL), and (b) computing integer factorization reduces to f(IF). These are the first complete functions that have explicit reductions from significant cryptographic primitives.
paper_title: NPMV-complete functions that compute discrete logarithms and integer factorization
